newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Mayne says Optus stake sale crucial.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Mayne says Optus stake sale crucial.

text.p: Transport, security and health care group Mayne Nickless said on Thursday that failure to sell its 25 percent stake in Optus Communications by July would impair growth opportunities.
"I don't think the float option is realistic in the short term unless we want to do it while litigation is occurring, Mayne Managing Director Bob Dalziel told reporters.
He said the short term meant by June or July "because our goal is to exit our optus investment by June, July".
"We cannot let our failure to get out of Optus to impair our growth opportunities and it will if it goes past July."
Mayne has told credit rating agencies Standard and Poor's Corp and Moody's Investors Service that it would exit its stake by July.
Mayne said earlier in a statement accompanying its half year results that it was considering four other options to achieve a sale of its shareholding in Optus.
Mayne has said it wants to sell its stake in order to focus on its core businesses.
Optus Communications had planned to float in 1996, but the process has been held up by a dispute between shareholder in its associate, Optus Vision, and the Seven Network.
